thread.title: Eleven British tourists arrested in China 'for being part of a terror group'
thread.title_full: Eleven British tourists arrested in China 'for being part of a terror group' | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Eleven British tourists arrested in China 'for being part of a terror group'
text:
5 shares
View
comments
Nine British nationals have been arrested in northern China, the Foreign Office (FCO) has confirmed.
Two dual British-South African nationals were also detained by authorities, it was announced.
The FCO said it was 'seeking further clarification' on why members of the group were arrested.
The visitors were reportedly on an organised 47-day tour of ancient China and were arrested at Ordos Ejin Horo Airport in the province of Inner Mongolia, northern China. Pictured: The important regional city of HohHot
It is not clear when the 11 were detained and their ages and identities have not been made public by authorities.
An FCO spokesman told MailOnline Travel: 'Nine British nationals and two British-South African nationals have been detained in northern China.
 Amazing video shows daredevil US Blue Angel pilot flying so... Explore Victoria's It-Tokk market, visit the Azure Window... Ryanair asks court to halt 'illegal' strike by baggage... Know the dress code, avoid quiet streets and join a walking... 'Consular staff have visited the group to provide assistance and we are liaising with Chinese authorities.'
The Daily Star is reporting that the 11 Britons were part of a 20-person tour group that was detained at Ordos Ejin Horo Airport in the province of Inner Mongolia.
The visitors were apparently on an organised 47-day tour of ancient China.
It's also been reported that Chinese authorities have been changing their reasoning for the detention of the travellers, alleging that some members were part of a terror group or a banned organisation or had watched 'propaganda' in their hotel rooms.
It is not clear when the 11 were detained and their ages and identities have not been made public by authorities. Pictured is Ordos in Inner Mongolia
